pageContext.claim: “I don't even know what you're talking about.”
pageContext.analysis: A reporter asked Trump whether he directed his son Eric and attorney Michael Cohen to pay off Stormy Daniels during the 2016 campaign, to keep her from going public with her claims that she had an affair with Trump in 2006. Trump feigned ignorance in response to this question, as he had many times before, but Cohen later pleaded guilty to the payoff in Manhattan federal court and said Trump had given him the order. The Fact Checker has awarded Trump its toughest rating for these repeated denials, which we determined were lies. That's a more serious offense than Four Pinocchios.
